issue.title: php7 codeigniter 3 session_regenerate_id
issue.body: Message:  session_regenerate_id(): Failed to create session ID: user (path: tcp://127.0.0.1:6379?weight=1)

issue.title: Fix PHP session_write_close warning when writing empty session to Redis

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
I'm working on an application that will eventually save session data, but doesn't yet (other than for user logins).  Therefore, the session driver is loaded on each pageview but nothing is written to it.  I noticed that I was getting a `PHP warning: session_write_close(): Failed to write session data (user). Please verify that the current setting of session.save_path is correct ()`, and spent some time debugging.

It seems that if writing an empty session (that is, where `$session_data` is a blank string) to redis, the key isn't actually created in the redis store (expected redis behaviour, I guess).  Therefore, when the driver then runs the `setTimeout` function on that key, it returns 0, which triggers a failure in the `session_write_close` handler.

Therefore, my fix is to simply not set a timeout when the session fingerprint is equal to that of a blank session - as soon as some session data is added, the code runs as it originally did.

body:
I'm facing same problem under PHP7.1.4, CI3.1.6-dev on macOS Sierra.
There's an error in log file:`Session: Error while trying to obtain lock for ci_session:xxxxxx`.

I have the same problem and also error "Unable to obtain lock for [sessionKey] after 30 attempts, aborting.
I'm on CI 3.1.9 (latest now), PHP 7.0.0 , php-redis 4.2.0 , redis 3.2.12 .
After acquiring this error the request waits for 30 seconds and after that my session is destroyed and the user is logged out.
This happening on different URLs.
I have also run into this exact same issue on PHP 7.2 and CI 3.1.9 , this is only an issue for me on concurrent ajax requests.
Same here on PHP 7.0 and CI 3.1.10, also with concurrent ajax requests

Has anyone found a resolution for the `Session: Unable to obtain lock for ci_session:xxx` issue when using Redis for sessions?

We are also seeing this on PHP 7.4.20 and CI 3.1.11, and it is always related to concurrent ajax requests.
The best solution for me was to close the session (session_write_close) at the beginning of the method or wherever updating the session ended. It releases session lock for other concurrent requests.

Yes can confirm. As suggested above - applying session_write_close() to controller code, and reducing the number of simultaneous XHR calls on the page resolved the issue.

This could perhaps be highlighted in the Redis driver docs to assist other users with this issue- it does seem to be quite prevalent.

> On 26/08/2021, at 6:03 AM, George Petculescu ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> 
> @schmoove can you confirm that you have a good connection to the Redis server?
> If so, please open a new issue for this, and we will look into it.
> 
> @victory7 that is a workaround, and if there is really an issue with it, it must be fixed.
> 
> 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.

> applying session_write_close() to controller code

Well, that's not a solution to a potential race-condition bug...

No, but it solved the issue related to these messages appearing in our
logs, which was my original dilemma:

Unable to obtain lock for
ci_session:cb236210b5307317b63e4ca74458ca68aa2c984f after 30 attempts,
aborting.
